What is the course code and title for this class?
The course code is MCS*2020 and the title is 'Information Management.'

The course code is MCS*2020 and the title is 'Information Management.'

The course code is MCS*2020.

MCS*2020 is 'Information Management.'
What department is this course under?
This course is under the Marketing and Consumer Studies department.

This course is under the Marketing and Consumer Studies department.

MCS*2020 is part of the Marketing and Consumer Studies department.

The Marketing and Consumer Studies department is responsible for the Information Management course.

The credit weight of this course is 0.50 credits.

This course is worth 0.50 credits.

The credit value of this course is 0.50 credits.

Is this course available in an online format?
Yes, this course is available as a distance education (online) course.
Is this course available online?
Yes, this course is available as a distance education (online) course.
Can I take this course online?
Yes, you can take this course online.
Is there an online version of this course?
Yes, there is an online version of this course.
What are some of the topics covered in this course?
Topics include the information economy, information systems and strategy, information ethics, fundamentals of digital marketing, data management, and introductory data analysis.
What topics are included in this course?
Topics include the information economy, information systems and strategy, information ethics, fundamentals of digital marketing, data management, and introductory data analysis.
What will we learn in this course?
We will learn about the information economy, information systems and strategy, information ethics, fundamentals of digital marketing, data management, and introductory data analysis.
What subjects does this course cover?
This course covers the information economy, information systems and strategy, information ethics, fundamentals of digital marketing, data management, and introductory data analysis.
How many units are there in this course?
There are 12 units in this course.

This course has 12 units.
What's the total number of units in this class?
The total number of units in this class is 12.
Can you tell me the number of units for this course?
This course has 12 units.
What is the required textbook for this course?
The required textbook is 'Management Information Systems: Managing the Digital Firm' by Laudon K. C. and Laudon J. P., 17th Edition, 2021.

The required textbook is 'Management Information Systems: Managing the Digital Firm' by Laudon K. C. and Laudon J. P., 17th Edition, 2021.
What book do we need for this course?
We need 'Management Information Systems: Managing the Digital Firm' by Laudon K. C. and Laudon J. P., 17th Edition, 2021.
What is the policy on using older editions of the required textbook?
Older editions cannot be used as access to MyLab is needed for assignments.
Can I use an older edition of the textbook?
Older editions cannot be used as access to MyLab is needed for assignments.
Are older editions of the textbook allowed?
Older editions cannot be used as access to MyLab is needed for assignments.

It is recommended to log in to CourseLink daily to check for announcements, access course materials, and review the weekly schedule and assignment requirements.

What is the policy on late submissions for assignments?
Late assignments are not accepted, but there is flexibility built into the course structure to navigate missed deadlines. Specific policies apply to different types of assignments.
Can I submit assignments late?

Are late assignments accepted?
Late assignments are not accepted, but there is flexibility built into the course structure to navigate missed deadlines. Specific policies apply to different types of assignments.
What is the policy on academic misconduct in this course?
Academic misconduct is not tolerated. Ensure all work submitted is your own and adhere to the University of Guelph’s policy on academic integrity.

What is the assessment breakdown for this course?
The assessments include Chapter Simulations (12%), Quizzes (20%), Excel Assignments (25%), Discussions (6%), SONA Research Component (2%), and Final Exam (35%).
